Comment: The key word in your first sentence is "mess". It's hard to successfully take over a country if you and everyone around is an incompetent dope. Especially a country where the election is as decentralized as it is in the United States.  Just within the last week:   * Trump has had to pull two nominees because Republican lawmakers who are seen as vulnerable in the midterms have told him they're not voting for them. One of those lawmakers (Thom Tillis) Trump was able to bully into supporting Hegseth back in January. * Trump's "big beautiful" spending bill is causing House Republicans to fight among themselves because (once again) Republicans who are in swing districts don't want to cut programs like Medicaid and lose their seats in 2026. This has led Trump to give the (unthinkable) order, "Raise taxes on the wealthy," Which Mike Johnson and co. have collectively responded to with, "Lol. No." * Per this article, his own ambassador is walking back and downplaying a claim that, until today, every member of his administration when asked (included the "sane" ones like Rubio) have doubled down on. * He even (seemingly reluctantly) walked back the 2028 talk. Basically begrudgingly acknowledging within in the last week, the fact that he "doesn't think" he can run in 2028.  That doesn't sound like someone who can successfully launch a coup. We've seen him try to do a coup firsthand, if you step back from the emotion you feel that it happened in the first place and look at it objectively, it was a pretty shit attempt at a coup and he caved within hours.  And yes, I know you (or someone) will probably pull out the, "The Nazis weren't competent," But they were compared to the Trump Administration. And Hitler had popularity with both the public and the rest of the world going for him. People hate Trump.
Author: Subliminal_Kiddo
